procedure.title: Limiting the rate of messages
procedure.para: The &agentabbrev; can control the rate of messages (message per second) sent to the central server. That way sudden message-bursts can be avoided, and the load of the server is decreased.
To limit the number of messages sent to a destination, complete the following steps:

step.para: Start the configuration interface of the &agent; application.

Select Destination Global Settings. To limit the number of messages that the &agentabbrev; sends to the server per second, enter the desired limit into the Throttle field. By default (0), the &agentabbrev; does not limit the number of messages sent.
The throttling parameter applies to the total number of messages sent, not to every source independently. The same value applies to every destination.
Click OK. To activate the changes, restart the &agentabbrev; service.
